meanings.sent1: The loud noises from the construction site were desensitizing my ears.
meanings.sent2: The continuous exposure to violence in movies was desensitizing the audience.
meanings.sent3: I guess I've become desensitized to spicy food after eating so much of it.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the bees outside was desensitizing my sense of peace.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive nature of the alarm clock was desensitizing me to its urgency.

meanings.definition: To make less sensitive to a stimulus over time.
meanings.sent1: The gradual exposure to sunlight was desensitizing her skin to burns.
meanings.sent2: The repeated use of numbing cream was desensitizing the patient's pain receptors.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his love for ice cream was desensitizing his taste buds to other flavors.
meanings.sent4: The constant honking of car horns was desensitizing the neighborhood to noise pollution.
meanings.sent5: The daily practice of meditation was desensitizing her mind to stress triggers.
